Traffic backups reported leaving the Cape

Drivers leaving the Cape after the long holiday weekend are encountering a 6-mile backup at the Sagamore Bridge. I-95 north remains clear. (Globe, 2:58 p.m.)

Boston working to keep buses on time

Boston schools Superintendent Carol R. Johnson (pictured) has enacted a number of changes to make sure that the chronically late buses that have defined the opening of the past two school years are history. (Boston Globe)

Boston casino plan needs cities’ support

Suffolk Downs has said that the opening of its proposed $1 billion resort — and doing the project in phases — won't happen without the support of Revere and Boston. (Globe)
